hero.body1: We work with 3–5 clients at a time. Every engagement starts with a 4-week observation period — no major changes, just data. From there we build a protocol that fits your life, not the other way around.
hero.body2: Minimum commitment: 6 months. This is not a quick fix.

capacity.title: 3–5 clients. That's it.
capacity.body: Real coaching requires real attention. We deliberately keep our roster small so every client gets the depth of analysis and responsiveness they deserve. No templates. No group programs. Just focused, 1-on-1 work.

engagement.title: What working with us looks like

items.title: 4-Week Baseline
items.description: Before we change anything, we observe. We collect data on your sleep, training, nutrition, bloodwork, and daily rhythms to understand where you actually are.

items.title: Personalized Protocol
items.description: Based on your baseline, we build a protocol across all five pillars — training, nutrition, sleep, emotional health, and medical metrics — tailored to your goals and constraints.

items.title: Ongoing Iteration
items.description: Protocols evolve. We meet regularly, review data, adjust variables, and consolidate gains. The goal is sustainable progress, not dramatic overhauls.

about.title: About
about.body:
I've been a passionate athlete for over 15 years, and along the way I naturally started coaching people around me. What began as helping friends improve performance turned into a deep interest in building strength, endurance, and health that lasts.

Today I work with only 3–5 clients at a time for a minimum of six months. We begin with four weeks of baseline monitoring to understand your current habits, constraints, and stressors—so the plan is sustainable from day one. From there, we build an individualized strategy across training, nutrition, sleep, and recovery, and track progress with objective metrics (e.g., VO₂ max, fitness benchmarks, and wearable data) plus regular check-ins.

cta.title: Ready to start?
cta.body: Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. If we have capacity, we'll schedule an introductory call within a week.

hero.title: Five pillars
hero.body: Longevity isn't one thing — it's five things working together. We address each pillar individually and as part of an integrated system.

items.title: Training
items.description: Strength, cardiovascular fitness, mobility, and recovery — programmed as one integrated system. We design training around your schedule, injury history, and long-term structural goals. The aim is to build a body that performs well at 40, 60, and beyond.

items.title: Nutrition
items.description: We take a data-informed approach to nutrition — no ideology, no fads. We track biomarkers, body composition, and subjective energy to find the dietary pattern that supports your training, cognitive performance, and metabolic health.

items.title: Sleep
items.description: Sleep is the single highest-leverage variable for health and performance. We use wearable data and subjective logs to optimize sleep architecture — not just duration, but the quality and consistency of each stage.

items.title: Emotional Health
items.description: Stress, relationships, purpose, and psychological resilience are not separate from physical health — they are foundational to it. We address the mental and emotional dimensions of longevity with the same rigor we apply to training and nutrition.

items.title: Medical & Metrics
items.description: We work with your medical team to track the biomarkers that matter. Comprehensive bloodwork, advanced imaging when appropriate, and longitudinal tracking give us an objective view of how your body is responding to the protocol.
details: DEXA, coronary calcium, and other imaging

cta.title: See how it all fits together
cta.body: Every pillar reinforces the others. The result is a protocol that compounds over time.

hero.title: How it works
hero.body: Every engagement follows the same three-phase structure. We observe before we act, build methodically, and consolidate for the long term.

phases.title: Observe
phases.description: We don't change anything yet. For four weeks we collect baseline data — sleep architecture, training logs, nutrition patterns, bloodwork, and subjective well-being. This gives us a clear picture of where you are before we touch a single variable.

phases.title: Build
phases.description: With a solid baseline in hand, we introduce changes one layer at a time across the five pillars. Each intervention is tracked and measured so we know exactly what's working. We move deliberately — stacking changes only when the previous layer has stabilized.

phases.title: Consolidate
phases.description: Once the core protocol is in place, we shift to maintenance and optimization. Regular check-ins, periodic re-testing, and seasonal adjustments keep you progressing without burning out. This is where the long game lives.

steps.title: Submit your application
steps.description: Fill out a brief form telling us about your goals, current health status, and what you're looking for in a coaching relationship.

steps.title: Introductory call
steps.description: If there's a good fit, we'll schedule a 30-minute call to discuss your situation in more detail and answer any questions.

steps.title: Onboarding & baseline
steps.description: Once we begin, you'll receive access to our tracking tools and start the 4-week observation phase right away.

hero.title: Testimonials
hero.body: Hear from clients who have been through the process. These are placeholder testimonials — replace them with real stories as they come in.

items.quote: The 4-week baseline period seemed slow at first, but it completely changed how I understood my own body. The data we collected gave us a roadmap I never could have built on my own.
items.name: James R.

items.quote: I've worked with trainers and nutritionists before, but never someone who looked at all five dimensions together. The integration is what makes this different.
items.name: Sarah M.

items.quote: What I appreciate most is the patience. No rushed changes, no dramatic overhauls. Just steady, evidence-based progress that I can actually sustain.
items.name: David K.

items.quote: The sleep optimization alone was worth it. My deep sleep went from 45 minutes to nearly two hours, and everything else improved downstream — mood, training recovery, focus.
items.name: Maria L.

items.quote: I was skeptical about the emotional health pillar, but it turned out to be the missing piece. Managing stress properly unlocked progress in every other area.
items.name: Tom W.

items.quote: Having someone who actually reads my bloodwork, understands my training data, and connects it all together — that level of attention is rare. The small roster makes a real difference.
items.name: Elena P.

cta.title: Join them
cta.body: When a spot opens, we'll review your application and reach out to schedule a call.

hero.title: Built from rethinking everything.
hero.subtitle: Not from a textbook. Not from a certification course. From 15 years of serious training, one hard lesson about extremes, and an analyst's obsession with what the evidence actually says.

origin.title: Fifteen years of doing it every way.
origin.p1: I started training seriously in my late teens — competitive sport, strength training, endurance, everything. I approached it the way I'd later approach finance: with intensity and a bias toward optimization. For years that meant more volume, more supplementation, more aggressive protocols. The results were real. So were the costs.
origin.p2: I studied psychology and management, then went deep into finance — earning the CAIA designation, one of the most demanding credentials in alternative investment analysis. That training gave me something that changed how I approached health: a framework for thinking in decades, not quarters. For managing complexity without being fooled by noise.

tipping.title: The moment I stopped chasing peaks.
tipping.p1: Somewhere in my early thirties I had the same realization that separates good investors from great ones. High-volatility strategies look brilliant in a bull run. But compounding over decades doesn't come from peaks — it comes from avoiding catastrophic drawdowns. I was optimizing for the wrong thing.
tipping.quote: The goal stopped being to be as extreme as possible. It became: how do I still be doing this, feeling this good, at 70?
tipping.p2: I cut the supplement stack to what the evidence actually supported. I traded maximum volume for minimum effective dose. I started treating sleep and stress as seriously as training load. The results didn't drop — they compounded. That was the tipping point that built everything Applied Longevity stands for.

credentials.title: Why background matters in a field full of noise.
credentials.subtitle: Anyone can build a landing page and call themselves a longevity coach. Here is what I actually bring — and why each credential is relevant, not decorative.

caia.title: CAIA — Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst
caia.description: One of the most rigorous designations in finance. The CAIA trains disciplined thinking about long-horizon portfolios, risk management, and filtering evidence from noise. The same analytical framework I apply to your health — because your body is a long-duration asset that compounds or deteriorates based on how it's managed.

psychology.title: Psychology & Management
psychology.description: Behavior change is the hardest part of any health protocol. A degree in psychology isn't background color here — it's why interventions actually stick. Understanding motivation, habit formation, and how people relate to systems over time is what separates coaching that lasts from programs that expire at week twelve.

trainer.title: Certified Personal Trainer
trainer.description: Formal validation of fifteen years of lived experience. Programming, movement mechanics, load management — done correctly and with precision. The certification mattered not as a starting point but as a structured second opinion on everything I'd learned through practice.

nutrition.title: Certified Nutrition Coach
nutrition.description: No dogma, no tribe, no nutrition wars. Certified in nutritional science with the explicit goal of applying evidence rather than ideology. Useful precisely because years of personal experimentation gave me a real-world lens to stress-test the theory against.

portfolio.title: Your health is a portfolio. Manage it like one.
portfolio.p1: This is where my background in alternative investments becomes genuinely useful — not just an interesting footnote. The CAIA curriculum teaches you to think in decades, not quarters. To diversify across uncorrelated assets. To protect the downside before chasing the upside. To make decisions based on evidence, not narrative.
portfolio.p2: A longevity protocol works exactly the same way. Training, nutrition, sleep, stress resilience, bloodwork — these are your asset classes. They compound together. They also drag each other down if mismanaged. Most coaches optimize single variables. Applied Longevity manages the whole portfolio.

years.label: Years of practice
years.description: Athlete, experimenter, coach — in that order.

clients.label: Clients at any time
clients.description: Not scalable by design. Real coaching requires real attention.

minimum.label: Minimum engagement
minimum.description: Because meaningful change has a time horizon. Like any good investment.

baseline.label: Baseline before any change
baseline.description: We observe before we act. Every engagement starts here.

observe.title: Observe before you act
observe.description: Every engagement starts with four weeks of baseline data collection. We don't change anything until we understand where you actually are — not where you think you are.

roster.title: Small roster, deep work
roster.description: I work with 3–5 clients at a time, for a minimum of six months. This is not scalable by design. Real coaching requires real attention. There are no shortcuts here.

evidence.title: Evidence over ideology
evidence.description: No fads, no tribal nutrition wars, no miracle supplements. We track what actually changes — bloodwork, wearables, fitness benchmarks — and adjust accordingly.

sustainable.title: Stability as the strategy
sustainable.description: The goal is a protocol you maintain for decades, not a 12-week transformation. We build habits and systems that compound the same way good long-term investments do.

cta.title: Want to work together?
cta.subtitle: If this resonates, apply below. I read every application personally.

hero.title: Apply
hero.body: Fill out the form below to express your interest. We review every application personally and respond within one week.

form.instructions: Replace this with your Typeform or Tally embed code.

next.title: What happens next

steps.title: We review your application
steps.description: Every application is read carefully. We're looking for alignment — not just goals, but readiness and commitment to the process.

steps.title: Introductory call
steps.description: If there's a mutual fit, we'll schedule a 30-minute call to discuss your situation, answer questions, and determine next steps.

steps.title: Onboarding begins
steps.description: You'll receive onboarding materials, access to tracking tools, and instructions for your 4-week baseline observation period.

next.note: We typically respond within 5–7 business days. If we're at capacity, we'll let you know and add you to our waitlist.
